column2: ENGLISH
You abandon your plot to usurp your wife's titles, for now.\n
Abdicate primary and equivalent tier titles to a same-realm heir, pretender, or claimant of the §Y[Root.Religion.GetName]§! faith. If none exist, abdicate to §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!.\n
Send word that you accept the invitation\n
Grant holy leave to attack
Recent Succession

The recent succession may cause some political turmoil within your realm. Your council will be §YDiscontent§!, and your vassals are more likely to make demands and form §YClaimant§! factions against you.\nIf you are a King or Emperor, becoming coronated (through the decision) and gaining the §YCrowned§! trait will help ease the tensions.

Begin the formalization process of the Bogomilist faith. Note that this may take up to decades, though seeing it through to the end will ensure that formalization does not also come with massive upheaval amongst the faithful.\n
Bogomilism is still nowhere near ready for formalization, and is further away from that goal than when the process began.\n

Reforming the $RELIGION$ faith will turn it into an organized religion with a religious head. Unless you control all of the Holy Sites, doing so requires §Y$AUTHORITY_REQ$§! Moral Authority and control of §Y$HOLY_SITES_REQ$§! $RELIGION$ holy sites. It will cost you §R$PIETY_COST$§! [Player.Religion.GetPietyName]. Rulers of a Reformed Pagan religion can use the Holy War Casus Belli, get access to most succession laws, no longer suffer Prestige loss while at peace, and will have less trouble with independent-minded vassals. However, they also lose the ability to raid, county conquest and subjugation Casus Bellis, defensive supply limit penalty for religious enemies in their territory, and vassals will get upset if you have their levies raised for too long for no good reason.

All women who have a landed title may now serve as an Advisor on the ruler's council.\n

All women who have a landed title, who are considered 'holy women' (such as a nun), and those who are of the liege's dynasty (including all close relatives and the liege's spouse) may hold the office of [Root.Holder.GetChancellorName].\n

All women who have a landed title, as well as those who are of the liege's dynasty (including all close relatives and the liege's spouse) may lead armies and hold the office of [Root.Holder.GetMarshalName] so long as they also have either the §YMartial Lady§!, §YLady of Horse and Bow§!, or §YShield Maiden§! trait.\n

All women who have a landed title, who are considered 'holy women' (such as a nun), and those who are of the liege's dynasty (including all close relatives and the liege's spouse) may hold the office of [Root.Holder.GetSpymasterName].\n

All women who have a landed title, who are considered 'holy women' (such as a nun), and those who are of the liege's dynasty (including all close relatives and the liege's spouse) may hold the office of [Root.Holder.GetTreasurerName].\n
Absolute Cognatic succession law is now permitted, and all women may now hold all non-religious council offices.\n
Women may no longer serve as Advisor on the ruler's council.\n
